post_text: July 18, 2014 at 8:27 PM#1I'm looking for a more graceful way to achieve the followingI've built an exec (eg 1.1.210) that takes a GO, shifts color to open, then has an follow to cue 2 which has a cmd "Off Executor 1.1.210" which turns the exec off.  I've set off time to 0.7This has the effect of snapping the fixtures to open white and the fading back to the underlying color (nice with LED fixtures).  It all works fine untill I need to move the button; at which point I have to update the cmd to refer to the new location.My question: Is there a way for an exec to refer to itself dynamically?  Kind of like the new $SELECTEDEXEC in 3.0.0.4 but without it having to be the selected exec.  something like $SELFEXECOr maybe a different way to achieve the same end result.Thanks in advance

posts.author: Tom Young
posts.post_text: July 30, 2014 at 3:03 PM#6Hiya,What about if you recorded cue 1 which has the colour bump to open and give it a time of 0 seconds. Give the executor an off time of 0.7 or whatever you want it to be.Then change the mode for that cue to be "Release".As soon as the cue has finished running it will then automatically release itself.Does that do what you're after?Cheers!Tom
